other_tests.findings: The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits. The contour of the liver is smooth. There is no focal liver mass. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. There is no intrahepatic biliary dilation. The common bile duct is mildly dilated, measuring 8 mm. There is cholelithiasis, gallbladder wall thickening and edema, as well as edema within the gallbladder fossa, concerning for acute cholecystitis. The pancreas is not well visualized, largely obscured by overlying bowel gas. The kidneys show no hydronephrosis.
